data.title: Friday night dinner
data.text: We frequent this restaurant every few months because the atmosphere, food and staff are all great.  The food is fresh, tasty and reasonably priced.

data.title: Lunch with a friend
data.text: Very good Asian fusion restaurant. The place is located on the second floor in the hotel promenade. The service is average but with a smile. They serve sushi to Thai to Chinese and it's all good.  Never had a bad meal or sushi at this place. Which is definitely a good thing. I can't recommend anything in particular since it really is all good. Enjoy

data.title: 2nd floor experience of delicous mildly priced asian food.
data.text: I was there on a date for the first time and had drinks, sake and dinner for 2 for under $100. The quality of the food was excellent and nice environment from sitting at the bar to private booths.

data.title: DISAPPOINTING
data.text:
If you're coming for drinks, nice bar and atmosphere.
Food, presentation is five-star and tastes as good as it looks.
The service was non existent from the hostess to the wait staff.

With all the restaurants in White Plains, RUN to any other.

And the only reason you get 1 star is because we are not allowed to give you none.

data.title: Chic,Hip/Fun & Delish food!
data.text:
The very appropriately named Wild Fusion is located on main street in the heart of White Plains next to the Cumbria Hotel. The food was fresh and delicious, the presentation very creative. We had salmon sushi rolls with jalapeno peppers sauce, duck shumai, coconut jumbo shrimp, lobster and beef medallions.
The restaurant has 2 levels modernly decorated, vibrant bar, some of the drinks are wild! served on the actual pineapple and after 10 p.m. there's a D.J. in the house on the second floor for those who want to practice their dancing with the stars move. You can tell a lot of thought was put into every detail from the led crystals, lighting, to the warm color on the banquettes, booths, etc. Complimentary parking available at the Cumbria hotel  when you spend $25 (but must get ticket validated at the restaurant)  or at the Municipal Parking lot for a fee.

data.title: Food that's Fun
data.text: We ordered some "adventurous" styles of sushi. The staff new we were experimenting and made all kids of recommendations. Was a great ice-breaker for a bunch of business folks eating together for the first time.

data.title: Creative delight
data.text: Wonderful and creative dishes to delight. Loved their fusion combinations. Food was beautifully prepared and delicious

data.title: Vegas-like feel
data.text: Have eaten there several times. Interesting and large menu, fair prices, food much better than average, big space with a Las Vegas feel and some outside dining.  Attractive presentations.

data.title: Asian Food Lounge
data.text: This place has good food at a good value. Even though it's over the top in decor. Usually there is some sort of mellow groove or lounge music playing in the background. All I can say is try it out. They have great specials throughout the week. Cheap eats and drink specials. What more can you ask for?

data.title: Good Asian Food
data.text: Drinks are very good!  Very nice atmosphere, seating is quick.  Sushi is GREAT and creative.  Food is always very hot and good.  Great place for after work drinks.  Love that you can eat outside when the weather is nice.

data.title: Not consistent
data.text:
The size of the portions of the lunch menu varies and I was disappointed when the size of the dish I usually order was smaller than usual.
It is a pity !

data.title: Not Great but Not Bad
data.text:
The owners clearly spent a fair bit to decorate the place but which may or may not be pleasing depending on your taste.  I guess I'd say the food and service doesn't really live up to the effort or expenditure of the build out.  

That's not to say the food is bad-  just not better than the typical strip mall sushi or Chinese restaurant that otherwise makes you happy.  To be clear I've eaten here a few times and in each case enjoyed it. 

The good thing is that the price matches the food not the decor which makes it all a fair value.  I will definitely dine here again.

data.title: Wildly Amazing!
data.text: The photos I took don't do it any justice.  The food is just slamming!  The king crab roll with rainbow Tobiko is mouth watering and delivers. The sea bass is always very good. I have been here a few times and each visit is consistent. Really good Sushi. really good fish.  The staff is nice.  I wouldn't say the service is outstanding but the food and atmosphere really is worth it.

data.title: Love them
data.text: The decor in this place is decidedly upscale, but the prices are pretty reasonable. Staff are friendly and attentive. The seats are almost all booths so it's very comfortable. Boyfriend had the seafood treasure and I the vegetarian delight and we liked both. We also learned they have "happy hour" on Sat. night from 9 pm to close so we'll be back!

data.title: New Years Eve destination
data.text: As always food was excellent and the service could not have been better. If you're going on a night like new years eve, do book on advance it get crowded fast

data.title: One word...YUMMY!!
data.text: I am a huge sushi fan, but also addicted to Geral Tsoa's Prawn. Sizzing sweet, sour and spicy!! DELISH. If you are staying at CAMBRIA Hotel the restaurant will give you 10% off your bill. Just show your room key and they will fix the bill. My daughter had the sushi and we also ordered the gyoza which were really good. In the good weather you can sit outside overlooking the main street-really nice, but inside is very updated and trendy, too!

data.title: Yummy
data.text: Pad Thai, Coconut Shrimp, AWESOME. Super convenient to the Cambria. Healthy choices galore, quick and efficient service.

data.title: Delicious sushi and drinks next to Cambria Hotel
data.text: Delicious food with excellent presentation, hipster atmosphere, cool lighting, we enjoyed the harvest moon martini, lychee martini, pan fried shrimp dumplings and chicken skewer appetizers, husband had snapper entree and i super enjoyed the delicious strawberry field roll and Hawaii roll... left the restaurant absolutely stuffed!

data.title: Good food Good values
data.text: This Asian restaurant was new when we moved back to White Plains last year. We have had dinner here 6 or 7 times. While our selections have not varied much, the dishes were consistently tasty.

data.title: Decor outshines food
data.text:
Had dinner at Wild Fusion on a recent Friday evening.  As previously noted, this new two-story W.P. fusion is striking in its design, with a modern, hip atmosphere that is pleasing to the eye.
Unfortunately neither the food nor the service measures up to the atmosphere.  To begin with, the pretty young hostess had no record of the reservation which was definitely called in several days in advance of our meal, and instead of arguing with us about whether we had or had not made a reservation, she could have merely apologized and just seated us in the almost empty restaurant.
Second, the waiter brought our main courses out while most of us were still eating our soup so they had to be sent back - not a problem with the sushi dinners but annoying for the people who had ordered hot food.
Third, the same waiter managed to spill part of everyone's main course on the table as he was handing the plates around.  It was almost comical, and he apologized very nicely, but really, had he ever worked as a waiter anywhere else, we wondered.
The sashimi platters were simply beautiful to look at, but the fish was unevenly cut and, oddly, not very flavorful.
Prices are reasonable, and the place is really attractive.  They just need to get a better handle on customer service, and maybe a new sushi chef.
I'd go for a drink, but there are many better places for Japanese food.
